Most Recent Result(13/12/2021 12:48 PM IST)

Resiliency Questionnaire Test Results for Vikas Gupta

Test Completed Date : 13/12/2021 12:50 PM IST

Your employer is dedicated to maximizing your resiliency and quality-of-life so they implemented the Resiliency Program. The questionnaire you completed was the first step. Step two was analyzing your results to develop a plan designed on your needs. The following information has been designed specifically for you based on your questionnaire results (see background definitions)

Resiliency refers to your ability to deal with physical and emotional stress without triggering a negative physical or emotional response. As your resiliency declines you start to become burnt-out and may begin to have physical and emotional symptoms and lose quality-of-life.

Burnout occurs when the amount of physical and emotional energy required to do a job is not returned in the benefits achieved from doing the work.

Resiliency = Burnout = Quality-of-life

Burnout = Resiliency = Quality-of-life

Your Resiliency Program score was calculated utilizing your individual scores for; Enthusiasm, Fatigue, Motivation and Negativity sections in the Resiliency questionnaire you completed.

Enthusiasm - is the excitement and satisfaction you feel for the work you do. A high score lowers your chance of having Burnout and promotes Resiliency.

Fatigue - refers to the amount of physical and emotional energy your work provides or takes from you. A high score increases your chance of having Burnout and reduces Resiliency

Motivation - is your personal drive to do a good job, no matter what obstacles are in your way. A high score lowers your chance of having Burnout and promotes Resiliency.

Negativity - refers to the loss of confidence that you and/or your work matter. A high score increases your chance of having Burnout and reduces Resiliency.

Your sections scores showed the following:

High Enthusiam promotes Resiliency

Low Fatique promotes Resiliency

Low Motivation promotes Burnout

High Negativity promotes Burnout

Your resiliency questionnaire indicates that you have Burnout which impairs your ability to handle any physical or emotional stress. You may have noticed an increase in your physical and emotional symptoms over the last few months. Burnout reduces your quality-of-life and negatively affects your personal and work life. By making some lifestyle changes and focusing on improving your resiliency you will improve and regain the quality-of-life you deserve. You do not need to make major changes to improve but rather regular daily steps. The information provided below will help guide you.

There are 5 levels of Burnout:
  1. Resilient,
    2.
  2. Mild,
    3.
  3. Minimal,
    4.
  4. Burnout and
    5.
  5. Severe.
    6.

People with severe burnout are more likely to have physical and emotional symptoms and a poor quality-of-life. A person in the Resilient level will tend to have a higher quality-of-life.

The following steps have been shown to improve your Resiliency and lower your Burnout. We will be sending you daily reminders to help you incorporate these positive steps and maximize your quality of life.

Step 1: Nutritional supplementation is extremely effective in improving resiliency. They help the mind and body rebuild from years of being overly stressed. Nutritional supplements will help reduce your physical and mental complaints while rebuilding your ability to handle life?s stressors.

Click here to see nutirional supplements

Step 2: Lifestyle changes are an excellent way to improve your resiliency.

Click here to see some recommended lifestyle changes

Step 3: Mindfulness training and focus exercises will improve your resiliency.

Click here to see mindfulness training and focus exercises

Rebuilding your resiliency takes time and done in a 1000 little steps. Incorporating the steps above on a daily basis will improve resiliency which we will retest in 90 days.

To help you incorporate healthy habits we will send you short and simple exercises and reminders on a daily basis.
